oai_dc:dc.dc:title: List of bridges and trestling destroyed and grading to be done on the Nashville Northwestern Railroad
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Railroad bridges; Railroads -- Tennessee; United States -- Army -- Quartermaster Corps
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: List from the U. S. Army Quartermaster of the bridges and trestling destroyed on the Nashville Northwestern Railroad, including bridges to be built or rebuilt, and grading to be done. The list enumerates each item by section and includes length, height of trestle, and cubic yard of grading. It includes a letter describing the projects, their cost, and the guard and stockade necessary for the construction.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Record Group 21, Adjutant General's Office Records, 1796-1900
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Quartermaster of the Army provides logistical support to the combat troops in the form of ammunition, clothing, food, and pay. Railroads were used extensively in the U.S. Civil War and were frequently the target of raids by both sides. Troops and supplies were transported via rail, which was the most vulnerable line of communication for both the Union and the Confederacy.
